greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = sigma(n)^2.
reference: S. Ramanujan, Some formulas in the analytic theory of numbers, Mess. Math. 45 (1915), 81-84, eq. 15. (Reprinted in Collected Papers of Srinivasa Ramanujan, Chelsea Publ., New York 1962, 133-135)
link: J. G. Wurtzel, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..10000
formula: Dirichlet g.f.: zeta(s)*zeta(s-1)^2*zeta(s-2)/zeta(2*s-2), Re(s)>3. - Antonio G. Astudillo (afg_astudillo(AT)hotmail.com), Jul 21 2002
Multiplicative with a(p^e) = ((p^(e+1)-1)/(p-1))^2. a(n) = Sum_{d|n} n/d*sigma(d^2). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Jul 30 2002
Equals the Dirichlet convolution of A065764 by A000027: a(n) = sigma(n^2) * n. - _R. J. Mathar_, Apr 02 2011
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 26 2002
